The fool-hardiness of scheduling
games out of class was certainly
seen in Saturday's State-Yale
game. State, already crippled by
having bitten off more than she
could chew, was unable to send a
team to New Haven worthy of
representing her. Yale consequently pulled out a number of secondstring players who she had started
and substituted third-team men.
And the results go down in football
history as a Yale-Maryland clash!
A battle between the freshmen
teams of the two institutions would
have been just as satisfactory.

DR. WHITEHEAD HONORED

By HERBERT REED,
In New York Times.

The Johns Hopkins University
has long been noted for producing
men who become leaders in their

ATHLETIC GOSSIP
The fool-hardiness of scheduling
games out of class was certainly
seen in Saturday's State-Yale
game. State, already crippled by
having bitten off more than she
could chew, was unable to send a
team to New Haven worthy of
representing her. Yale consequently pulled out a number of secondstring players who she had started
and substituted third-team men.
And the results go down in football
history as a Yale-Maryland clash!
A battle between the freshmen
teams of the two institutions would
have been just as satisfactory.
